word_mean: 原始的：具有最简单的和最不发育特征的

sentence.Network_en: Twenty million years ago, Idaho was populated by dense primordial forest.
sentence.Network_cn: 2,000万年前，爱达荷州到处都是茂密的原始森林。
生命的根本真实性是精神.

sentence.Network_en: Twenty million years ago, Idaho was not the arid place it is now. Rather, it was warm and damp, populated by dense primordial forest.
sentence.Network_cn: 2,000万年前，爱达荷州并不像现在这样干旱。相反，那时的爱达荷州温暖潮湿，有大片的原始森林。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin primordialis 'first of all', from primordius 'original' (see primordium)

entry.tran: 原始的；远古的；人类最初的
entry.def: You use primordial to describe things that belong to a very early time in the history of the world.

example.ex: Twenty million years ago, Idaho was populated by dense primordial forest.
example.tran: 2,000万年前，爱达荷州到处都是茂密的原始森林。

means.word_mean: 1. having existed from the beginning; in an earliest or original stage or state;

sentences.sentence: "primal eras before the appearance of life on earth"
